title: Law amending Law relating to the Civil, Commercial, Labour and Administrative Procedure
title_en: Law amending Law relating to the Civil, Commercial, Labour and Administrative Procedure

provisions.title: Article 217 - of Law n o 22/2018 of
provisions.content: 29/04/2018 relating to the civil, commercial, labour and administrative procedure is amended as follows: “The bailiff seizes property in the presence of at least the owner or the co-owner or the garnishee or the debtor and the Executive Secretary of the Cell where the property to be seized is located or any other person representing the government organ. The bailiff prepares a seizure statement indicating clearly the list of seized property, its identification, location, the garnishee and the guardian. The copy of the statement is submitted to the owner of seized property or the co-owner or the garnishee or the debtor

provisions.title: Article 2 - Definitions
provisions.content: In this Order, the following terms have the following meanings: 1° blood components: major blood components including plasma, platelets, red blood cells and white blood cells; 2° plasma: a light-yellow liquid part of blood that remains after red blood cells, white blood cells, platelets and other cellular components are removed from blood. It is the most important component of human blood, comprising about fifty-five percent (55%) and contains water, salts, enzymes, antibodies and other proteins; 3° plasma fractionator: manufacturing plant that performs plasma fractionation; 4° Minister: Minister in charge of Health; 5° Institution: The public institution charge of processing blood components.

provisions.title: Article 225 - of Law n o 22/2018 of
provisions.content: 29/04/2018 relating to the civil, commercial, labour and administrative procedure is amended as follows: “The bailiff has the following competence: 1° to transmit judicial documents and decisions to concerned persons; 2° to certify that enforcement orders meet requirements for being enforced; 3° to certify facts he or she witnessed on the request of the person who wishes to have it recorded in statement; 4° to take decision of seizure and make a statement; 5° to determine modalities for management of the seized property; 6° to proceed to public auction and make its report; 7° to carry out other duties provided for by the law. The bailiff uses the forms provided for that purpose determined by the Minister in charge of justice and such forms are published on the website of the Ministry of Justice and on the website of the Professional Bailiffs Association. The bailiff records any form relating to the execution of an enforcement order by appropriate electronic system within forty- eight (48) hours from the date he or she made the form.”

provisions.title: Article 255 - of Law n o 22/2018 of
provisions.content: 29/04/2018 relating to the civil, commercial, labour and administrative procedure is amended as follows: “The auction is conducted electronically as follows: 1° the bailiff publishes in appropriate electronic system a reference price that is equivalent to the value indicated by the valuation mentioned in Article 252 of this Law; 2° an eligible bidder fills in the appropriate electronic system the price he or she intends to offer for the property. His or her names and the price he or she offers are kept secret until the prescribed time for publication of prices; 3° at the time of declaring the successful bidder, the electronic system is opened and the prices offered and the names of bidders are disclosed to bidder, the seller, the debtor, the owner of the property and the creditor; 4° a price offered in the appropriate electronic system by a bidder who does not meet the requirements is null; 5° at the time of declaring the successful bidder, the electronic system is opened. The highest bidder is declared the successful bidder. He or she must pay the price and send the payment receipt by filling in the appropriate form electronically within seventy-two (72) hours. This period begins from the time at which he or she was notified that he or she was successful in obtaining the property; 6° if the time referred to in item 5° of this Article lapses without the successful bidder paying, the property is reauctioned; 7° if several bidders have offered the same highest prices, the bidder who first offered the price electronically is the winner. If he or she fails to pay within the time referred to in item 5 of this Article, the bidder with the same price who comes in the following position to offer the price electronically is the winner, and he or she is also required to comply with the period of seventy-two (72) hours which begins from the time at which he or she was notified that he or she was successful in obtaining the property. The same applies if the bidder who comes in the following position fails to pay. If no bidder among those who have offered the same highest prices pays, the property is re-auctioned. The prices offered electronically remain valid until the closure of the auction. The owner of the property or the distrainee, the distrainer or the creditor have the right to decline the highest price offered at the first round and at the second round in case no price reaches seventy-five percent (75%) of the reference value. At the third round, the property to be auctioned is given to the bidder who offered the price that is higher than other prices offered during all the rounds of the auction. During the auction, the owner of the property or the distrainee, the distrainer or the creditor have the right to find themselves the buyers that can bid through the electronic procedure available. An Order of the Minister in charge of justice determines the format, management and use of the electronic system used in the execution of enforcement orders and the system to be used in case the electronic system fails to operate”.

provisions.title: Article 4 - Quality requirements
provisions.content: The organ in charge for regulation of biological products determines quality requirements of plasma for sale.

provisions.title: Article 261 - of Law n o 22/2018 of
provisions.content: 29/04/2018 relating to the civil, commercial, labour and administrative procedure is amended as follows: “The bailiff responsible for the auction shall issue the deed of the auction, an original copy of the deed of auction is given to the successful purchaser upon production of the proof that he or she paid the required amount of money charged during the auction. The successful purchaser become owner of the property after payment, he or she can register the property on his or her name after submitting a copy of deed of sale to competent authorities. When the purchaser makes payment, the bailiff immediately pays the creditor into a bank account given by the creditor or, failing that, a bank account determined by the Minister in charge of Justice, which also is the account into which the balance of the amount of the auction is deposited. The bailiff is responsible of payment of the sold property. If he or she does not demand payment of the sold property and omits to reauction it, he/she is personally liable for the price. All expenses made since the seizure until completion of the auction are paid by the owner of the auctioned property, from the amount obtained from the auction.”

provisions.title: Article 5 - Selling procedure
provisions.content: A plasma fractionator writes to the Institution expressing the interest to buy plasma. The Institution assesses the request referred under Paragraph One of this Article and accepts or rejects the intention of plasma fractionator to buy plasma. The plasma fractionator assesses if plasma comply with the needed quality. If the plasma fractionator finds that the plasma complies with the required quality, concludes a collaboration agreement with the Institution.

provisions.title: Article 266 - of Law n o 22/2018 of
provisions.content: 29/04/2018 relating to the civil, commercial, labour and administrative procedure is amended as follows: The report of the closing of an auction includes the following: 1° the judgement or enforcement order that was executed; 2° mention of the concluding of an agreement contract, if any; 3° mention of the seizure made on the property to be auctioned and the date of seizure; 4° a list of seized property; 5° mention of the publication of the auction, and the date of publication; 6° a list of items sold in the auction; 7° a list of the competitors in the auction; 8° the price fixed by valuers; 9° the final price at which the property was sold; 10° the identity of the purchaser; 11° the way and time of payment; 12° the time and way of payment of the creditor. When an auction is suspended, invalidated by failure to pay, or cancelled, and opens again, they are also mentioned in the report. Documents specifying all actions taken are annexed to the report and the latter is published in the Database of Judgements Enforcement.

provisions.title: Article 6 - Report on the quantity of blood
provisions.content: collected and plasma extracted The Institution submits to the Minister written report indicating the quantity of blood collected, the quantity of plasma extracted, the quantity of plasma needed by health facilities and the excess plasma. After analysis of the written report referred in Paragraph One of this Article, the Minister authorizes the Institution to sell the excess plasma.

provisions.title: Article 280 - bis, to be worded as follows:
provisions.content: “Article 280 bis: Legal provisions that apply to the published auction The auction that was published in the Database of Judgements Enforcement before the publication of this amending Law in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda is published afresh in accordance with the provisions of this amending Law. However, if the successful bidder was declared before the publication of this amending Law, he or she pays in accordance with the amended Law. If he or she fails to pay, the auction is published afresh in accordance with the provisions of this amending Law.”

provisions.title: Article 7 - Authorisation to buy plasma and
provisions.content: certificate to export plasma The institution issues to a plasma fractionator an authorisation to buy the plasma for one (1) year which may be renewed upon agreement of both parties. The Institution applies in writing for certificate of export to the organ in charge of regulation of biological products.

provisions.title: Article 8 - Cost of plasma
provisions.content: The cost of plasma cannot be less than fifty United States Dollars (USD 50) per liter. The price referred to in Paragraph One of this Article, is reviewed every year after consultations between the Ministry in charge of health and the plasma fractionator.

provisions.content: This Law comes into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda. provisions.title: Article 1 - Purpose of this Order
provisions.content: This Order determines the blood components which may be sold and the applicable procedure thereof.

provisions.title: Article 3 - Blood components to be sold
provisions.content: Plasma is the blood component to be sold.
